intro: Zaluzianskia deflexa, commonly known as the redstem filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Zaluzianskia deflexa thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
